title: Recognize the Signs of Hypertrophic Cardiomyopathy

sections.heading: Overview
content: Hypertrophic cardiomyopathy (HCM) can thicken the walls of your heart’s left ventricle (chamber). This makes it hard for your heart to pump oxygen-rich blood out to your body.
HCM can run in families, often without symptoms. Sometimes, symptoms can show up later. Discover the signs and what symptoms to watch for with hypertrophic cardiomyopathy.

Without enough oxygen-rich blood to your heart, you can get mild chest pain, called angina. It can feel like indigestion and may get a bit worse during or after exercise. But with rest or medication, this harmless discomfort goes away.
